summary: Completed comprehensive testing of enhanced manpower marketplace with new features: bulk job upload, job seeker applications, and enhanced filtering. Backend APIs are fully functional (100% success rate), but frontend has critical UI issues preventing complete user flows.

ui_bugs.issue: User type dropdown options (Enterprise, Vendor, Job Seeker) are not clickable - elements exist but are not visible/interactive

integration_issues.issue: Login fails with 401 error - test users from backend tests don't persist for frontend testing
integration_issues.impact: Cannot test authenticated user flows in frontend

passed_tests: Backend: All 22 API tests passed (100% success rate)
Backend: User registration for all three personas (Enterprise, Vendor, Job Seeker)
Backend: Enterprise profile and facility creation
Backend: Job creation and bulk upload via CSV
Backend: Job seeker application system with duplicate prevention
Backend: Enhanced filtering by city and role
Backend: Dashboard statistics including application counts
Backend: Vendor job filtering and commitment system
Frontend: Homepage loads correctly with proper branding
Frontend: Navigation to registration and login forms
Frontend: Login form displays with proper fields
Frontend: UI components have proper data-testid attributes for testing

success_percentage.frontend: 30% - UI loads but critical interaction bugs prevent full testing

action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix registration form dropdown interaction issue. The dropdown options for user type selection (Enterprise, Vendor, Job Seeker) are not clickable, preventing new user registration. This is blocking the complete user flow testing. Also consider adding persistent test data or seed data for frontend testing.
